010package imagingbook.common.filter.linear;
011
012import imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic;
013
014/**
015 * This class implements a x/y-separated 2D Gaussian filter by extending
016 * {@link LinearFilterSeparable}.
017 * 
018 * @author WB
019 * @version 2020/12/29
020 * 
021 * @see LinearFilterSeparable
022 * @see GaussianFilter
023 */
024public class GaussianFilterSeparable extends LinearFilterSeparable {
025        
026        /**
027         * Constructor accepting a common sigma for x/y.
028         * @param sigma the width of the 2D Gaussian in x- and y-direction
029         */
030        public GaussianFilterSeparable(double sigma) {
031                super(new GaussianKernel1D(sigma));
032        }
033        
034        /**
035         * Constructor accepting individual sigmas for x/y.
036         * If any sigma &le; 0 or NaN, i.e., the corresponding x- or y-pass is not performed.
037         * 
038         * @param sigmaX the width of the 2D Gaussian in x-direction
039         * @param sigmaY the width of the 2D Gaussian in y-direction
040         */
041        public GaussianFilterSeparable(double sigmaX, double sigmaY) {
042                super(makeKernel(sigmaX), makeKernel(sigmaY));
043        }
044        
045        private static GaussianKernel1D makeKernel(double sigma) {
046                if (Double.isFinite(sigma) && sigma > Arithmetic.EPSILON_DOUBLE) {
047                        return new GaussianKernel1D(sigma);
048                }
049                else {
050                        return null;
051                }
052        }
053        
054}
